intro: Heudusa candicans, commonly known as the shining heudusa, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually ovate and covered in a fine, waxy coating that gives them a shiny appearance. Heudusa candicans is often found in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
